metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5727 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, there is an integer overflow vulnerability in the opj_t1_encode_cblks function (openjp2/t1.c). Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file. It was discovered that OpenJPEG incorrectly handled certain BMP files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1').
